meanings.definition: The emission of light by a substance that has absorbed light or other electromagnetic radiation.
meanings.sent1: The fluorescence of the glow stick made it easy to find in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The fluorescence of the stars in the night sky is truly mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The fluorescence of the fireflies created a magical atmosphere in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a fluorescence that lit up the room.
meanings.sent5: The fluorescence of the neon sign attracted customers from afar.

meanings.definition: The property of emitting light while exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The fluorescence of the light bulb brightened the room.
meanings.sent2: The fluorescence of the moonlight illuminated the path ahead.
meanings.sent3: The fluorescence of the flashlight made the camping trip more fun.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm had a fluorescence that energized the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The fluorescence of the fire danced in the darkness of the cave.
